name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Wallace FEASTER, Appellant

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C.J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
LARSEN, J., filed a concurring opinion.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Wallace FEASTER, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
The judgments of sentence are affirmed, without prejudice to appellant’s right to select new counsel, not associated with present counsel, to represent him on the issue of ineffectiveness of trial counsel.
LARSEN, J., filed a concurring opinion.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

opinions.text:
LARSEN, Justice,
concurring.
I would hold that trial counsel can never act as appellate counsel when ineffective assistance of trial counsel is an issue.
opinions.author: LARSEN, Justice,

attorneys: Nino V. Tinari, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Robert B. Lawler, Chief, Appeals Div., Victor Fortuno, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
434 A.2d 716
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Wallace FEASTER, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Jan. 20, 1981.
Decided Sept. 24, 1981.
Nino V. Tinari, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Robert B. Lawler, Chief, Appeals Div., Victor Fortuno, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C.J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
